results.title: Eight months to Mars
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: This film shows the problems encountered in sending Mariner IV 325 million miles through space to explore Mars. Designed to inform the layperson in terms which will be understood, the film also explains scientific readings and photographs from Mariner IV. Narrated by John Fitch.

results.title: The Eiffel Tower
results.creator_credit: Alain Pol and Le Monde en Images
results.brief_description: How four French alpinists climbed the Eiffel Tower - from the outside. Using rock climbing techniques, the party scales the steel girders to the top, 1,000 feet above ground level. In hot pursuit, an angry policeman ascends the tower by the more conventional stairs and lifts, but to no avail.

results.title: Egypt and the Nile
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of Egypt and the Nile Valley as seen against its historical background. Emphasises the importance of the Nile River in the whole pattern of Egyptian life. Includes scenes of an ancient temple to the sun god at Abu Simbel, the dam at Aswan, the delta of the Nile, the Suez Canal, and the cities of Asyut, Cairo, and Alexandria.

results.title: Egypt: a new horizon
results.creator_credit: Alfred Wagg Pictures and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.

results.title: Egretta
results.brief_description: A life history of the four species of egrets commonly found in Australia, the white egret, the great egret, the white crane and the white heron.

results.title: Ego development: the core of a healthy personality(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur M Kaye and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the establishment of ego qualities and the setting and achievement of goals in very young children. Proper resolution of the conflict between biological, psychic, and societal demands leads to the establishment of a healthy ego

results.title: The Egg of oryzias latipes
results.brief_description: Artificial fertilization of the killifish. through constant research a method of artificial fertilization of the transparent eggs of killifish or oryzias latipes, in Ringer’s solution was discovered. The delayed-action camera shows the process observed through the microscope.

results.title: Effects on alternating current and power factor
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Induction and Capacity”.
Illustrates the effects of inductors and capacitors on alternating and direct current circuits; reduction of power factor by high natural capacity or inductance of AC circuit; use of inductors or capacitors to improve power-factors; applications to fluorescent lamps and telephone cables.

results.title: Effective writing: revise and improve
results.brief_description: Illustrates various ways in which writing can be improved by reconstructing sentences, substituting better words, and using the dictionary. Depicts the tribulations of a high school student attempting to write a composition. Produces images of the content of his composition on screen as he revises and corrects his work with the help of the narrator.

results.title: Effective listening
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Demonstrates the importance of effective listening in the communication process. Points out the obstacles to effective listening and suggests ways for the listener to become aware of these obstacles and remedy them.
